name: Uwi
headline: Financing solutions for Southeast Asia housing backlog
description:
uwi is the Figure of Southeast Asia, originating our Express Building loans and securitizing in the backend. 

uwi has launched its flagship loan program called Express Building (EB) to help small and medium sized residential developers scale their affordable housing development pipeline. 

Current markets: Indonesia & Philippines

founders.name: Joseph Tan, Founder
founders.description: Former real estate executive who has invested & developed $3B+ in commercial and residential real estate in North America. Scaled a Canadian self storage platform to a $310MM exit.

founders.name: Emmanuel Rex Rodriguez, Founder
founders.description: A highly experienced hands on developer who is always on the forefront of change.  Has handled million dollar infrastructure budgets as well as hands programming on applications serving tens of thousands of concurrent users.

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Uwi**

Founded in 2022 and nestled in the bustling city of Singapore, Uwi is on a mission to tackle the housing backlog in Southeast Asia. With their flagship product, the Express Building (EB) loan program, Uwi provides financing solutions tailored for small and medium-sized residential developers in Indonesia and the Philippines. This innovative approach not only aims to ease the burden on the housing market but also to empower developers to scale their affordable housing projects effectively.

Uwi operates in an intricate space that blends fintech with real estate, categorized under various tags like B2B and PropTech. It's worth noting that Uwi is part of Y Combinator’s Batch S22, which speaks volumes about their potential and backing. Their small but mighty team of 14, led by Group Partner Brad Flora, is steadfastly working to refine their approach to financing.

### How It Works

Uwi's Express Building loan is essentially a short-term bridge loan designed to cover the gap between the issuance of official building permits (NOA/LOG) and the eventual bank home loan take-out. Here’s a quick breakdown of the process:
1. **Submission of Business Documents**: Developers kick off by submitting necessary paperwork.
2. **Approval & Post-Approval Requirements**: Once approved, they’ll need to meet additional criteria.
3. **Receive Funds**: Funds are disbursed to the developer.

The EB loan covers 100% of the approved construction budget, with interest-only monthly payments until the principal is repaid at maturity. An important aspect is the flexibility offered with a possible extension of up to 60 days—no prepayment penalties make it even more appealing.

### Current Focus

Uwi is currently laser-focused on Indonesia and the Philippines, two vibrant markets with pressing housing needs. With their innovative financing solutions, they are looking to be a significant player in addressing this shortage.

If you're a developer in the region and looking for a partner that understands both the intricacies of financing and the housing landscape, Uwi might just be the right fit for you.

For more information, visit their website: [Uwi Homes](https://www.uwihomes.com)
